article_text: "I think most of you remember this. This is my brace from my scoliosis. I had to wear this 22 hours a day for two years. I was really nervous to wear it to school for the first time. But you were all so accepting. I remember Brooke (Harriman) asking in the locker room after gym one day what it was, and then asking to try it on. Everyone was so supportive and I can't tell you how much that meant to me," said Allen, the valedictorian and class president of Morristown's Class of 2015.

og.description: MORRISTOWN--Alyssa Allen held up the brace she once wore as she stood before her classmates at Saturday's Morristown graduation ceremony.
og.title: Family atmosphere supports Morristown graduates
